greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Bessel polynomial {y_n}''(-1).
reference: J. Riordan, Combinatorial Identities, Wiley, 1968, p. 77.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..400
Index entries for sequences related to Bessel functions or polynomials
formula: a(n) = 2*n*(n-1)*(1/2)_{n}*(-2)^(n - 1)* hypergeometric1f1(2 - n, -2*n, -2), where (a)_{n} is the Pochhammer symbol.
mathematica: Join[{0, 0}, Table[4*n*(n-1)*Pochhammer[1/2, n]*(-2)^(n-2)* Hypergeometric1F1[2-n, -2*n, -2], {n, 2,20}]] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 14 2017 *)
program: (Sage) f=factorial; [0,0]+[sum((-1)^k*f(n+k+2)/(2^(k+2)*f(n-k-2)*f(k)) for k in (0..n-2)) for n in (2..20)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 10 2019
(GAP) f:=Factorial;; Concatenation([0,0], List([2..20], n-> Sum([0..n-2], k-> (-1)^k*f(n+k+2)/(2^(k+2)*f(n-k-2)*f(k)) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 10 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 08 2001
